comments_since_last_sample.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*

We have people that were involved in the George Floyd protests still paying fines and doing probation *today* for minor offenses while the January 6th terrorists mostly walk free with a check mark on the chalkboard by their name.

And that's just the George Floyd protesters that *survived*.

It took a surprising amount of googling to find out that former Attorney General **Jeff Sessions** sidelined the office rather quietly:  
[https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/01/us/politics/office-of-access-to-justice-department-closed.html](https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/01/us/politics/office-of-access-to-justice-department-closed.html)
If there is justice for all get get going with the investigation of 1/6.

Garland - do your job. Where is the justice for Jan 6? 

If we do not see justice for January 6th - we lose our democracy. I’m not being dramatic. We are in a serious amount of hurt and I see absolutely no action.

Holy shit you guys, Garland DID SOMETHING!!!

I know, I know, it wasn't any of the things we have been demanding he do like "restore the rule of law" or "prosecute terrorists" but hey - something just happened at DoJ! Maybe he woke up from his (checks notes) 10 month nap.
Dont yap on and on about equal justice while giving people who invaded the capitol a slap on the wrist and 4 months on house arrest. Actions speak louder than words buddy.
This is quite a big deal because it reestablishes an office of Legal Aid.  This is 100% about equal access.   Imagine how many people are disenfranchised because they cannot afford a lawyer.

Fine.  But now please get serious about the Jan. 6th rioters/insurrectionists.  Nonviolent civil rights protesters have served more time than you are pushing for with these dangerous criminals who tried to overthrow our democracy.
When is Garland going to start prosecuting the leaders of the January 6 insurrection?
Cool story bro, now prosecute Bannon already.
Makes sense, after all Merrick Garland doesn't have anything else pressing that needs to be done
OK, fine. Now do something to *actually* restore "access to justice" for traitors, swindlers, white-collar criminals, and con artists.
